pages.transcription:
Carthage, IL Nov. 26th 1906
Mr. Luther A Brewer
Dear Sir
Pardon my delay. the Ice Storm prevents my getting out. Yours of the 15th came to hand the 17th. Your sign your name Luther A. Brewer, but give no personal address therefore I will answer your questions and send some Notices of the book which will cost you 2,14. Two dollars & the postage which has never been lower than fourteen cents. The Publisher managed to make way with the Steriotyped plates, so I took all the books remaining and now hold them at 2.00 & postage. When I have to Mail them as the book is out of print. 
Mr Earl G. Swem has in his hands to sell for me anything I may have on

Iowa.  My Father Thomas Gregg author
of the book in question published
a paper where Montrose now stands
before Iowa was even Iowa Territory.
He moved into the old barracks of the
old Fort Des Moines, for his dwelling.  his nearest
white neighbors were the Killbournes & a Mr. Austin
of N. Y. later of Kentuck, who were land speculator
of what was known as the Half Breed Tract,
and Father printed the hand bills, & advertized
in said paper the first sale of lots for
the City of Keokuk.  His place of residence
soon changed from old Fort Des Moines Wisconsin
Territory to Montrose Iowa Territory, which is now
Montrose Iowa.  Father lived there & published said
paper about three possibly more years, & during
that time acted as Justice of the Peace & mail
carrier, which latter was quite dangerous as he made
daily trips to Nauvoo, which was then known as
Commerce, across the river by Idian Canoe.
and now it is Nov 21st P.M. & still storming.
As I am left alone in the world as

regards family or near Relatives it
becomes quite imperative, that I take
good care of my health, therefore I cannot
tell at this hour when I will be able to
get but any.  Will not mail book however
until I hear from you again.
Yours Truly Stella D. Gregg,
P. O. Box 634        Carthage, Illinois
